page.title: 06Population around Scoutmoor.
page.content: By examining this area it was found to be sparsely populated due to the fact that it was rural with rugged terrain, hills and farmland. The people tended to dwell in chusters, the main two being the villages of{Turn}and {Shuttleworth.}More remote parts were populated by isolated farms and other dwellings. The population consisted mainly of the elderly who had either lived there all their lives, or moved there on retirement. The population seemed to be gradually expanding with some new houses being built and the average age of the population was declining with more young families moving in. The people interviewed in the area were found to be very friendly and co-operative.
